mosais.GUI

Class MosaisGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • mosais.GUI.MosaisGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MosaisGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The graphical interface to the mosais program TODO: A cool effect can be created by reusing the same full image object from 1 run to the next, specifically when going from a low density mosaic to a high density mosaic.
    Author:
    andrew
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • initComponents

        private void initComponents()
        This method is called from within the constructor to initialize the form. WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is always regenerated by the Form Editor.

      • picSelectBtnActionPerformed

        private void picSelectBtnActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Open a file chooser when the picture select button is clicked. If the user selects a valid file, load the full size image and display a scaled image in the GUI. The start button will enable, allowing the mosaic to be generated.
        Parameters:
        evt - Button dispatching this event.

      • saveImage

        private void saveImage(java.awt.event.ActionEvent clickEvent)
        Save the most recently generated mosaic to a file. Opens a file chooser to allow the user to enter the file name for the output file. Allowed Formats: jpg, png, gif, bmp.
        Parameters:
        clickEvent - Button dispatching this click event

      • startBtnActionPerformed

        private void startBtnActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Generate and apply the mosaic pattern or points if points only selected
        Parameters:
        evt -

      • scaleImage

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage scaleImage()
        Scale the image if either dimension is greater than the max
        Returns:
        scaled image if scaling performed, full image otherwise.

      • redrawImage

        private void redrawImage()
        Redraw the draw area after making a change to the image. Scale the image if necessary before drawing. set the container sizes to the image being drawn make sure the frame is the correct size after resizing.

      • flushImage

        private void flushImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
